tweet: Congratulations to @realDonaldTrump for his impromptu meeting at the Korean DMZ. Making history by effectively using technology like Twitter to improve international relations. Thank you, Mr. President, for not just doing things differently but also doing them better!
Enjoyed the thoughtful and informative conversation with @AIPAC members to discuss regional security and peace. pic.twitter.com/2ep2oq7t7z

This year’s Democrat leadership agenda has focused on extreme policy proposals that put politics over the American people. We need bipartisan policy which puts Americans first – not America alone, but country first. pic.twitter.com/viUDBRlM4d

Pleased Democrat leadership finally came to their senses in joining the Republicans in passing the Senate’s bipartisan bill that funds humanitarian assistance at our southern border. While the bill is not perfect, it’s a step in the right direction. https://meuser.house.gov/media/press-releases/meuser-statement-house-passage-amended-hr-3401 …

Democrat leadership just denied my unanimous consent request to consider the Senate’s bipartisan bill to provide humanitarian relief at our southern border. This bill passed the Senate with 84 votes & could be signed by @realDonaldTrump today. We must pass this bill now! pic.twitter.com/LdtabP1bYM

I look forward to participating in tonight’s #CongressionalBaseballGame w/ @SteveScalise. Thank you to @PennStateSL for my jersey. The event has raised millions for charity historically. Fortunately, practices were at 6 a.m. & did not interfere with work. Come on out to the game! pic.twitter.com/HCHEVVsWV5

Big news – veterans who were exposed to Agent Orange in the offshore waters of Vietnam are now finally eligible for earned VA benefits. Thanks to @realDonaldTrump for signing the Blue Water Navy Vietnam Veterans Act. Proud to cosponsor and support this bill in the House!

Enjoyed meeting Cassidy from #PA09, who is this year’s Congressional Art Competition winner. She hails from Frackville, PA & just graduated from North Schuylkill High School. Cassidy’s work will be displayed in the U.S. Capitol for the next year. Well-deserved! pic.twitter.com/IKLsZKFFWR

I support H.R. 2196, which would reduce the credit hour requirement for the Edith Nourse Rogers STEM Scholarship program @DeptVetAffairs. The scholarship provides an additional 9 months of GI bill eligibility, or up to $30K in benefits, to student veterans pursuing a STEM degree. pic.twitter.com/mlVsYGm6Ig

Recently, I paid tribute to Pat Solano, who turns 94 tomorrow. Pat is a legend in #PA and a decorated war veteran who honorably served in #WWII. He is a true patriot and his friendship is valued by our community. Thank you for your service, Pat, and Happy Birthday! pic.twitter.com/jwl693CZPx

Productive conversation with @wisefoods & @UniquePretzels to discuss key legislative issues pertaining to the food industry. Together they employ hundreds of people in #PA09. pic.twitter.com/9zy59JiSvb

Enjoyed moderating an Economic Development Forum @PennStateSL with @SBAmidatlantic, @HUDMidAtlantic, & @RD_Pennsylvania. One of my top priorities is to foster growth & revitalization in #PA09. In the last two years, #PA’s economy has thrived. The state unemployment rate fell to 3.8% – its lowest level since 1976 – and PA added 115K jobs. Because of the #TCJA, the average taxpayer also saved more than $1,400 on their federal income taxes last year.

Great meeting with @alsassociation advocates to discuss important policy priorities to support those living with #ALS. I am proud to join the fight against ALS and work to find a cure. #ALSAdvocacy #ChallengeMe pic.twitter.com/ciAOXVQ8xg

For the first time, the #MovingWall – a tribute to American war heroes – will be in #Bloomsburg this weekend. The wall is a replica of the Vietnam Veterans Memorial, which honors more than 58K veterans killed in combat. Full story below: https://wnep.com/2019/06/13/a-moving-tribute/ …

Congrats to both Pine Grove (undefeated season; first state Class AAA title ever) and Williams Valley (third state title in Class A since 2013) for winning their respective PIAA softball state championships today. Well-deserved! #PA09

Looking forward to speaking about the key legislative priorities for #PA09 and listening to my fellow Pennsylvanians tomorrow at the Lebanon County Firefighter Convention. https://leb.town/2019/06/13/the-lcfa-firefighters-convention-is-this-weekend/ …
Happy #FlagDay! Today we commemorate the adoption of the American flag by Congress in 1777. In 1937, #PA became the first state to celebrate it as a state holiday. pic.twitter.com/W3Ohxk2pYG
